results.title: City of Geelong
results.creator_credit: John Heyer, Shell Company of Australia and Bern Gandy
results.brief_description: One hundred years ago, Geelong was aboriginal country. Today, from a town which was built on wool and wheat, it has grown to be one of the biggest regional cities in Australia. Besides serving as the natural port for the produce from the rich hinterland farms, it has developed many secondary industries which make it the most industrialised city per head in Australia. Fine modern buildings, famous schools, and beautiful beaches show it as an attractive and happy city. Nestled around Corio Bay, it is prosperous and expanding.

results.title: City of dreams: the collaboration of Marion Mahon and Walter Burley Griffin
results.creator_credit: Gaby Mason, Film Australia and Belinda Mason
results.brief_description: Walter Burley Griffin and Marion Mahony have long enjoyed accolades as one of the most important artistic collaborations of the 20th Century. In this documentary an overview of the collaboration of Walter Burley Griffin and wife and architectural partner Marion Mahony is addressed. The documentary connects the historical time-line of events in their lives to not only inform us about the architecture, but the political environment and the role that their personal dynamics had in contributing to their work. From early beginnings as the world’s first registered women architect and long-time designer for Frank Lloyd Wright, Marion Mahony is described as being Griffin’s intellectual sparring partner, muse and mentor. Documented is the incredible political corruption that Walter and Marion were confronted with and endured in Australia once being awarded the prize for their design of the new capital. Although they both decided to stay on in Australia after Canberra was completed and together produced almost 300 buildings around the country (including Sydney’s Castlecrag), it is evident that both lives suffered as a result of their ongoing battles with bureaucracy over the building of Canberra. What Marion and Walter have left is a legacy of strong vision and philosophical interest. Their dedication to their dream and aesthetic that sensitively addressed the environment and the balance of humans within this remains in their gardens and buildings.

results.title: City limits
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Laurence Hyde and David Bairstow
results.brief_description: Forthright, critical analysis of the problems of North American cities by Jane Jacobs, authority and author of books and articles on the subject. A former New Yorker, she chose to live in Toronto because “it is a city that still has options…it hasn’t made so many mistakes that it’s bound to go downhill.” Her remarks, and what this film shows, will interest all civic and community groups - in fact, all urban dwellers. Photography by Jacques Fogel, Albert Kish, Cameron Gaul, Raymond Dumas.

results.title: City life
results.brief_description: A light-hearted sketch of life in the city of Sydney. The hazards of driving and parking a car in the city area and the people in Hyde Park are seen against a background of light music. No narration.

results.title: City in siege
results.creator_credit: Sydney Newman, ONF | NFB, James Parker and Allen Stark
results.brief_description: A record of Winnipeg’s ordeal by flood in the spring of 1950. From the first overflowing drain to the broad sea that the Red River finally became, the film traces the course of this disaster. Scenes of wholesale destruction are matched by pictures of heroic rescue and defence work. When the waters recede we enter sodden houses to find mouldy walls, slimy floors and rotting furniture. But the film does not end on a note of despair - our last view of the flood area shows the work of reconstruction beginning with the removal of dykes and the restoration of roads. Voice and narration by Jack Scott. Photography by Robert Campbell and Hector Lemieux.

results.title: City highways
results.brief_description: An example of how heavily populated areas and shifts of population affect the lives of people. Promotes an understanding and appreciation of civic projects. Shows the planning, construction and use of controlled-access highways through metropolitan centres.

results.title: City girls
results.brief_description: Shows a bushwalking and outdoors activities program at the Mittagundy camp on the Bogong High Plains attended by unemployed girls from underprivileged backgrounds and girls of the same age from private school backgrounds. Notes in particular the way in which the girls respond to the various challenges of the camp.

results.title: city diary_05
results.brief_description: An anonymous digital dairy created by a young person as part of a day long workshop run by ACMI. Each diary is scripted and a voiceover recorded by the individual young person. Some diaries use photographs brought in by the participant, but the primary visual content is often black and white, ‘stock’ footage of a poetic nature. At no point should the creator or school be positively identified when screening this work.
